result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew K Chatman

defendant.name: Chatman, Matthew K
defendant.address: 198 E 1st St, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:05 a.m.    Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court goes over right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 9:15 a.m..

Court adjourned at 9:08 a.m.

*PROCESSING COMPLETED*

Note:  Citation has been moved to 2016CF70
